{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Architect",
  "description": "Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in the maintenance of high-rise building facilities with offices located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Architect

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;/ Onsite

Job&nbsp;Description


	Control project from start to finish to ensure high quality, innovative and functional design.
	Work with clients to determine requirements for building projects.
	Develop initial estimates on structure costs, building time and special requirements.
	Conduct site visits and inspection to monitor construction progress and quality.
	Prepare detailed drawings showing both the appearance and interior structure of a building project. eg. Plumbing, Ventilating System, Electrical System, etc.
	Direct staff in the development of project drawings, studies and budgets.
	Ensure that all works are carried out to specific standards, building codes, guidelines and regulations.
	Comply with safety standards and local planning regulations.
	Follow architectural trends and advancements.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Candidate must possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Architecture or any other related course.
	At least 5-7 years of work experience as an architect with a specialty on high rise buildings.
	Sound knowledge of Microsoft Office applications especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
	Proficient in the use of AUTOCAD and other computer aided programme.
	Candidate is expected to be familiar with operational HSE support for all activities.
	Strong analytical, communication and computer skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to:&nbsp;recruitment2@ekomaintenance.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",

  },

Architect Job at Eko Maintenance Limited




        
    

        
        Eko Maintenance Limited is a rapidly growing Facility Management Company that specializes in the maintenance of high-rise building facilities with offices located in Victoria Island, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time / Onsite

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Control project from start to finish to ensure high quality, innovative and functional design.
	Work with clients to determine requirements for building projects.
	Develop initial estimates on structure costs, building time and special requirements.
	Conduct site visits and inspection to monitor construction progress and quality.
	Prepare detailed drawings showing both the appearance and interior structure of a building project. eg. Plumbing, Ventilating System, Electrical System, etc.
	Direct staff in the development of project drawings, studies and budgets.
	Ensure that all works are carried out to specific standards, building codes, guidelines and regulations.
	Comply with safety standards and local planning regulations.
	Follow architectural trends and advancements.


Qualifications / Requirements


	Candidate must possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or any other related course.
	At least 5-7 years of work experience as an architect with a specialty on high rise buildings.
	Sound knowledge of Microsoft Office applications especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
	Proficient in the use of AUTOCAD and other computer aided programme.
	Candidate is expected to be familiar with operational HSE support for all activities.
	Strong analytical, communication and computer skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: recruitment2@ekomaintenance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business and Data Analyst",
  "description": "Hugo is a Future-of-Work company. We build and manage remote teams in black communities for some of the world&rsquo;s largest technology and media companies. We specialize in end-to-end machine learning data annotation and omnichannel support solutions that ultimately yield more inclusive outcomes for both black communities globally and our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Business and Data Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria

What you will be doing


	The Data Analyst, Talent Hub, will play a critical role in leveraging data to drive efficiency, accuracy, and strategic decision-making across the talent sourcing and assessment lifecycle.
	The role involves managing data flows across various platforms, analyzing assessment and performance metrics, and developing insightful dashboards and reports to support management decisions on talent supply, recruitment funnel health, and client headcount demand.


Key Responsibilities


	Data Management and Integration
	Collect, organize, and maintain data from multiple sources, including application platforms, assessment tools, and internal databases.
	Liaise with third-party testing and application vendors to ensure accurate, consistent, and timely data transfer.
	Ensure data integrity, consistency, and security across all talent-related databases.
	Support the continuous improvement of data collection and reporting systems to enhance reliability and usability.
	Data Analysis and Reporting
	Collate and analyze test and assessment results to identify performance trends, readiness levels, and skill distribution across the talent pool.
	Filter and segment the Talent Hub database to match client requirements and recruitment priorities.
	Generate periodic and ad-hoc management reports highlighting key metrics such as talent pipeline health, conversion rates, assessment outcomes, and sourcing efficiency.
	Build and maintain interactive dashboards to visualize key insights for leadership and operational teams.
	Track and report on alignment between talent availability and client headcount demand.
	Provide data-driven insights to inform recruitment strategies, sourcing optimization, and upskilling priorities.
	Governance and Quality Assurance
	Maintain data quality standards through routine validation, cleaning, and documentation.
	Support compliance with data protection regulations and internal data governance frameworks.
	Create and update reporting templates and standard operating procedures for reporting and analysis.


Qualifications And Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within HR, recruitment, or operations environments.
	Proven ability to work with large datasets and integrate data from multiple platforms (e.g., Zoho, test/assessment systems, ATS tools).
	Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, SQL, and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio.
	Strong analytical mindset, with the ability to translate data into actionable business insights.
	Experience creating and automating dashboards and management reports.
	Familiarity with recruitment or talent analytics is a strong advantage.


Key Competencies:


	Exceptional attention to detail and data accuracy.
	Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
	Excellent communication skills &mdash; able to explain technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
	Highly organized, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Collaborative and proactive approach to supporting business decisions through data.


What We Provide


	Hugo offers a hybrid work environment that balances employee flexibility with a collegial, fun office culture.
	We pride ourselves on offering a dynamic environment where ambitious professionals can make a measurable impact and accelerate their career. Our compensation and benefits are highly competitive.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-07",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-08",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "HUGO"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Abuja, Enugu, Lagos, Rivers (PH)",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190013"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Business and Data Analyst Job at Hugo




        
    

        
        Hugo is a Future-of-Work company. We build and manage remote teams in black communities for some of the world’s largest technology and media companies. We specialize in end-to-end machine learning data annotation and omnichannel support solutions that ultimately yield more inclusive outcomes for both black communities globally and our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business and Data Analyst

Job Location: Nigeria

What you will be doing
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Data Analyst, Talent Hub, will play a critical role in leveraging data to drive efficiency, accuracy, and strategic decision-making across the talent sourcing and assessment lifecycle.
	The role involves managing data flows across various platforms, analyzing assessment and performance metrics, and developing insightful dashboards and reports to support management decisions on talent supply, recruitment funnel health, and client headcount demand.


Key Responsibilities


	Data Management and Integration
	Collect, organize, and maintain data from multiple sources, including application platforms, assessment tools, and internal databases.
	Liaise with third-party testing and application vendors to ensure accurate, consistent, and timely data transfer.
	Ensure data integrity, consistency, and security across all talent-related databases.
	Support the continuous improvement of data collection and reporting systems to enhance reliability and usability.
	Data Analysis and Reporting
	Collate and analyze test and assessment results to identify performance trends, readiness levels, and skill distribution across the talent pool.
	Filter and segment the Talent Hub database to match client requirements and recruitment priorities.
	Generate periodic and ad-hoc management reports highlighting key metrics such as talent pipeline health, conversion rates, assessment outcomes, and sourcing efficiency.
	Build and maintain interactive dashboards to visualize key insights for leadership and operational teams.
	Track and report on alignment between talent availability and client headcount demand.
	Provide data-driven insights to inform recruitment strategies, sourcing optimization, and upskilling priorities.
	Governance and Quality Assurance
	Maintain data quality standards through routine validation, cleaning, and documentation.
	Support compliance with data protection regulations and internal data governance frameworks.
	Create and update reporting templates and standard operating procedures for reporting and analysis.


Qualifications And Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
	2–4 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within HR, recruitment, or operations environments.
	Proven ability to work with large datasets and integrate data from multiple platforms (e.g., Zoho, test/assessment systems, ATS tools).
	Advanced proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets, SQL, and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio.
	Strong analytical mindset, with the ability to translate data into actionable business insights.
	Experience creating and automating dashboards and management reports.
	Familiarity with recruitment or talent analytics is a strong advantage.


Key Competencies:


	Exceptional attention to detail and data accuracy.
	Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
	Excellent communication skills — able to explain technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
	Highly organized, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Collaborative and proactive approach to supporting business decisions through data.


What We Provide


	Hugo offers a hybrid work environment that balances employee flexibility with a collegial, fun office culture.
	We pride ourselves on offering a dynamic environment where ambitious professionals can make a measurable impact and accelerate their career. Our compensation and benefits are highly competitive.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Location: Wuse 2 - Apo Mall, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

	Monitor and reconcile cash, bank, and petty cash balances.
	Track and process vendor payments, staff reimbursements, and utility bills.
	Support monthly stock count and reconcile inventory variances with the store and kitchen teams.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial summaries for management.
	Assist in budget preparation, cost control, and expense monitoring.
	Ensure timely remittance of statutory deductions (e.g., VAT, PAYE, pension).
	Support internal and external audits with required documentation.
	Maintain proper filing and safeguarding of financial records.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
